thread.section_title: Business Breaking News | Finance & Business News | News.com.au
thread.title: Stocks to watch on Wednesday

author: news.com.au
title: Stocks to watch on Wednesday
text:
STOCKS to watch on the Australian stock exchange on Wednesday, Aug 26:
AHY - ASALEO CARE - up 9.5 cents, or 6.2 per cent, at $1.635
Toilet paper maker Asaleo says it's on track to increase full year earnings, despite headwinds from a strong greenback. AVG - AUSTRALIAN VINTAGE - down four cents, or 10 per cent, at 36 cents Australian Vintage says it is looking to increase sales in the United Kingdom, the United States and Asia in the year ahead, after its full year net profit fell 11 per cent to $9.4 million. BCI - BC IRON - up one cent, or 4.35 per cent, at 24 cents BC Iron has axed its dividend and pledged to cut its production costs further after the slide in iron ore prices saw it slump to a $158 million loss. BKL - BLACKMORES - up $9.56, or 10.6 per cent, at $100.00 Shares in the health products maker broke the $100 mark for the first time in the company's history after it announced a record annual profit. CWP - CEDAR WOODS PROPERTIES - down eight cents, or 1.6 per cent, at $4.92 Property developer Cedar Woods expects to maintain its record profit after shrugging off disappointing sales in key mining town projects. DLS - DRILLSEARCH - up 7.5 cents, or 12.4 per cent, at 68 cents Shares in Drillsearch Energy surged after the oil and gas producer's hedge program helped soften the impact of the slump in commodity prices. KMD - KATHMANDU - up 4.5 cents, or three per cent, at $1.54 Struggling retailer Kathmandu may cut up to 25 jobs from its head office as it looks to lift profit. ORA - ORORA - up four cents, or 1.85 per cent, at $2.20 The packaging company spun-off from Amcor lifted full year earnings in its Australasian operations, and forecast continued growth. SVW - SEVEN GROUP - up one cent, or 0.2 per cent, at $4.67 Kerry Stokes' Seven Group Holdings has posted a $360 million full year loss but the company plans to take advantage of the downturn in the resources sector to go shopping. WFD - WESTFIELD - down four cents, or 0.4 per cent, at $9.48 Shopping centre operator Westfield will meet its full year guidance despite a delay in opening its World Trade Center flagship. WOR - WORLEYPARSONS - up 48 cents, or 6.3 per cent, at $8.13 Engineering construction giant WorleyParsons has swung into the red with a $54.9 million full year loss.
